title: Are we living a meaningful life? - Quora

response.answer_text: Are we living a meaningful life? Yes. Every life we have is meaningful, whether we believe that or not. Why do I say that? Because the only mission or meaning we have here on Earth is to live and to experience. That’s it. Nothing more. So we can’t fail. We can’t not have meaning! (Apologies for the double-negative.) In my own case, my meaning also comes from my nearly-exclusive focus (outside my family) on becoming more present. I’ve been focusing on this for almost 17 years now and still have a ways to go. I may never make it. But the process is rewarding by itself and is — very slowly — making my life better by the day. I’d encourage others to do this too, if you’re drawn to it, but it’s not easy and, honestly, the first and single most important step is very simple… That step is learning to breathe properly. I’ve posted many descriptions of how to breathe here on Quora and I invite you to read through them. Once you learn to breathe properly, and you start breathing that way daily, the rest becomes possible. B.

It’s a very nice question. In this case, it looks like you use this word “meaningful” in the sense of satisfaction obtained. As opposed to a more literal sense which implies the kind of meaning that symbols have, you know, this means that, but I feel confident that isn’t what you mean (sorry). It’s not a remarkable life from what I understand is the common measure for that, great fame, great wealth, great contribution to the welfare of mankind material or artistic. It’s just another life, filled to the brim with moments of satisfaction, dissatisfaction, and a lot of neither. But there is one thing I might be able to convey, in words of all things, about this life, which is, it is probably a lot like yours in most meaningful ways, so if you were to just take a minute every day to look into yourself, sooner or later you should obtain a meaningful answer to your question.
